alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Lafayette; Nevada; Union (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 9:37PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Lafayette, western Union, southeastern Nevada and Columbia Counties through 1030 PM CDT... At 936 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near McNeil to near Bussey. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... El Dorado, Magnolia, Smackover, Waldo, Norphlet, Junction City, McNeil, Taylor, Emerson, Rosston, Willisville, Bussey, Mount Holly, Smithland, Atlanta, Wesson, Village, Lisbon, Macedonia and Calhoun. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for south central and southwestern Arkansas...and north central and northwestern Louisiana.
